isis.stitle: Procedural Guideline - ENGINE, REPLACE WITH SERVICE ENGINE (I-6E)

wtsproc.config: This vehicle is equipped with air conditioning, air brakes, and the NAVPAK computer design.

step1.para: Chock wheels.
Remove front bumper.
Disconnect battery.
Drain air tanks. Close valves (if applicable).
Disconnect wiring necessary to remove hood. Disconnect cables and hinge pins. Remove hood.
Raise vehicle. Use blocks of wood under front wheels.
Drain cooling system.
Drain engine oil.
Disconnect air inlet hose from air compressor (if applicable).
Remove complete air filter assembly.
Remove both charge air pipes.
Remove power steering reservoir from radiator frame. Lay aside and secure.

note.para: Do not open power steering system.

step1.para: If equipped with air conditioning, evacuate system.
If equipped with air conditioning, disconnect A/C lines at condenser.
Disconnect all coolant hoses from engine and radiator necessary to remove radiator assembly.
Disconnect radiator support struts at frame mounted support brackets.
Remove upper radiator support struts.
Install lifting device to radiator assembly.
Tilt radiator assembly slightly forward for access to remove fan assembly. Using proper tool, remove fan assembly (left hand threads).
Remove nut retaining radiator frame to support crossmember.
Remove radiator assembly using lifting device.
Remove air conditioning serpentine belt (if applicable).
Remove engine serpentine belt.
Remove engine serpentine belt tensioner.
Disconnect wiring to alternator.
Remove bolts retaining alternator mount bracket. Remove alternator with mount bracket attached.
Disconnect heater hoses at engine.
Remove surge tank hose from engine.

Disconnect A/C lines and hoses at air conditioning compressor. Remove bolts retaining air conditioning compressor mount bracket. Remove air conditioning compressor with mount bracket attached (if applicable).
Remove bolts retaining fan drive pulley. Remove pulley. Remove bolts retaining fan drive, and remove fan drive.
Disconnect exhaust pipe at turbocharger.
Disconnect air discharge line and governor lines from air compressor (if applicable).
Disconnect wiring at computer, include support clamps.
Remove computer. Remove computer mount bracket.
Disconnect block heater wiring at block heater.
Remove oil dip stick tube (oil fill tube).
Disconnect wiring from oil pressure sending unit.
Remove bolts retaining power steering pump to engine. Lay pump aside and secure.

note.para: Do not open power steering system.

step1.para: Remove engine covers (cab), both sections.
Disconnect air line support bracket at rear of engine (if applicable).
Disconnect fuel supply and return lines.
Disconnect engine wiring harness support brackets (valve cover area); secure wiring harness out of way for access.
Remove drive shaft.
Remove shift tower assembly from transmission. With 5 and 6+1 transmissions, remove from under vehicle. On vehicles with dual counter shaft transmission, remove floor assembly.
Disconnect electrical necessary to remove transmission.
Disconnect clutch linkage from clutch arm.
Remove clutch inspection cover.
Remove bolts retaining transmission to engine except two (2).
Secure transmission jack to transmission. Remove remaining two bolts retaining transmission.
Remove transmission. Position transmission out of way for access.
Disconnect wiring from starter. Remove left rear engine mount bolt and isolator for access to starter wiring harness support clamp. Remove support clamp.
Remove bolts retaining front engine mounts and right rear engine mount.

note.para: Steps 54 to 59 are performed to relocate lifting eye for a balanced lift of the engine.

step1.para: Remove valve cover, include disconnecting valve cover injector wiring harness.
Cover air intake ports.
Disconnect #4 injector wiring for access.
Remove cylinder head bolt between #4 and #5 injectors.
Remove lifting eye from rear of engine.
Install lifting eye between #4 and #5 injectors using head bolt. Be sure lifting eye is centered properly for clearance, as not to touch injectors. Tighten bolt.
Install lifting device to engine.
Remove engine from vehicle.
Transfer new engine to lifting device.
Transfer necessary parts to new engine.
Install engine into vehicle. Install all engine mount bolts. Do not tighten at this time.
Remove lifting device.
Tighten front and right rear engine mount bolts. Remove left rear mount bolt.
Connect wiring to starter, include support bracket to engine.
Install left rear mount bolt.
Remove rear lifting eye and install in original position.
Install cylinder head bolt. Torque to spec.
Connect #4 injector wiring.
Remove intake port covers.
Connect valve cover injector wiring harness to valve cover. Install valve cover. Torque bolts.
Install transmission to engine. Remove transmission jack.
Install clutch inspection plate.
Connect clutch linkage to clutch arm.
Connect electrical to transmission.
Install shift tower to transmission. Install floor assembly (if applicable).
Install drive shaft. Torque bolts.
Connect engine wiring harness and support brackets to valve cover studs.
Connect fuel supply and return lines.
Connect air line support bracket at rear of engine (if applicable).
Install power steering pump to engine. Torque bolts.
Connect wiring to oil pressure sending unit.
Install oil dip stick tube.
Connect block heater wiring to block heater.
Install computer mount bracket. Install computer to mount bracket. Torque all bolts.
Connect wiring to computer. Torque to spec.; include support clamps.
Connect air lines to air compressor (if applicable).
Connect exhaust to turbo.
Install fan drive and pulley. Torque bolts.
Install air conditioning compressor mount bracket, compressor and lines to compressor (if applicable).
Install surge tank hose to engine.
Connect heater hoses to engine.
Install alternator with mount bracket to engine. Torque bolts.
Connect wiring to alternator.
Install engine serpentine belt tensioner. Torque bolt.
Install engine serpentine belt.
Position radiator assembly in place using lifting device.
Install engine fan assembly.
Install upper and lower radiator support struts. Install lower radiator mount and nut.
Remove lifting device from radiator assembly.
Connect coolant hoses to radiator assembly.
Connect air conditioning lines to condenser (if applicable).
Charge air condition system (if applicable).
Install power steering reservoir to radiator frame.
Install charge air pipes.
Install air filter assembly.
Connect air inlet hose to air compressor (if applicable).
Lower front of vehicle.
Fill engine oil and coolant to proper level.
Install hood, hinge pins and cables. Connect wiring.
Install bumper.
Connect battery.
Start engine and check for leaks.
Install engine covers (cab).
Remove wheel chocks.
